about_text: 5th-year engineering student at EFREI, specializing in cybersecurity and IT governance. My goal is to leverage my technical and strategic expertise to support companies in the financial sector, particularly in IT audit and risk analysis. Through my work experience at EY and BNP Paribas, and my involvement in SEPEFREI, the school’s Junior Enterprise, I developed a comprehensive understanding of IT security, internal control, and project management. Dynamic and meticulous, I combine technical skills with organizational insight to help organizations achieve secure digital transformation.
skills: Internal control analysis and risk management
Technical review of application and infrastructure layers
Data analysis using SQL, VBA, Python, and AI
Internal audit (GRC tools, AI, data analytics)

experiences.title: IT Audit Intern – Financial Sector
experiences.description: Performed IT security controls as part of financial audit engagements focused on the financial sector.

experiences.title: IT Security Assistant
experiences.description: Contributed to access control projects, managed risk for 130 applications, and supported business continuity and cybersecurity compliance initiatives.

experiences.title: Cyber Prospecting Consultant (Freelance)
experiences.description: Commercial prospecting, data scraping, and use of Sales Navigator to identify qualified leads.

experiences.title: Cybersecurity Sales Manager
experiences.description: Conducted client meetings and implemented a sales strategy generating 12 appointments in one month.

je_paragraphs: Since 2022, I have been fully involved with SEPEFREI, the Junior-Enterprise of EFREI Paris — a student-run consultancy delivering engineering, development and advisory services to external clients.

My journey there has been marked by continuous growth, providing me with a broad understanding of organisational operations and strong skills in project management, leadership, strategy and team supervision.
I first joined as Project Manager (2022–2023), responsible for operational follow-up of client projects: requirement scoping, planning, quality control and coordination of technical contributors.
In 2023, I became Head of Sales, defining prospecting strategy, leading client meetings and strengthening customer relations.
The following year, I was elected Vice-President (2024–2025), where I supervised internal teams, ensured cohesion and contributed to a comprehensive risk analysis to enhance operational reliability.
Finally, in 2025, I was elected President of SEPEFREI. I now oversee strategic direction, people management (40+ members), and institutional relations with EFREI, CNJE and partners.
This experience taught me to lead, decide and inspire, while staying grounded in collective progress and continuous professionalisation.
